alert.note: Alert for City of Chesapeake; City of Newport News; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth; City of Suffolk; City of Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 7:14PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following independent cities, City of Chesapeake, City of Newport News, City of Norfolk, City of Portsmouth, City of Suffolk and City of Virginia Beach. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 714 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Virginia Beach, Newport News, Downtown Norfolk, Norfolk State University, Old Dominion University, Downtown Portsmouth, Ocean View, Virginia Wesleyan University, Churchland, Regent University, Kempsville, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Suffolk, Ghent, Norview, Norfolk NAS, Cradock and Norfolk International. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: City of Chesapeake; City of Newport News; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth; City of Suffolk; City of Virginia Beach
